properties.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Trinity; Southern Humboldt Interior; Northern Trinity; Del Norte Interior
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 9:08PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.A significant winter storm is expected to impact the region late
Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3000 to nearly 2000 feet early Thursday morning, which
will bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, and 3, in addition to
numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating small hail
will be possible across coastal areas late Wednesday night into
Thursday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 7 to
20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph.

* WHERE...Del Norte Interior, Northern Humboldt Interior,
Southern Humboldt Interior, Northern Trinity and Southern
Trinity Counties.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY
